title: Canyon
description: German direct-to-consumer brand delivering performance road, gravel and MTB bikes online worldwide.

title: Specialized
description: US brand building road, mountain and e-bikes, known for race-winning performance and in-house R&D.

title: Trek
description: American brand offering a full range from entry-level to WorldTour, with a focus on quality and innovation.

title: BMC
description: Swiss brand engineering high-performance road and time-trial bikes, backed by research from the Impec Lab.

title: Pinarello
description: Italian marque with Grand Tour pedigree, producing aerodynamic road frames like the Dogma.

title: Giant
description: Taiwanese company and the world's largest bicycle maker, known for value and innovation across categories.

title: Cannondale
description: American brand recognized for innovative aluminum and carbon designs across road, gravel and MTB.

title: Rondo
description: Polish brand focused on gravel and all-road performance with distinctive design.

title: Focus
description: German brand producing performance road and mountain bikes with a racing heritage.

title: Lapierre
description: French brand with decades of racing history across road and MTB disciplines.

title: Bianchi
description: Founded in 1885, the Italian icon known for its celeste color and heritage road bikes.

title: Cervélo
description: Canadian brand specializing in aerodynamic road, triathlon and time-trial bikes.

title: Colnago
description: Italian legend with a storied racing legacy and premium road frames.

title: CUBE
description: German brand offering a broad range of road, MTB and e-bikes with strong value.

title: ENVE
description: US company renowned for premium carbon wheels and components, plus performance road frames.

title: Factor
description: High-end racing brand producing aerodynamic and lightweight road bikes ridden at WorldTour level.

title: LOOK
description: French pioneer of clipless pedals and carbon frames, producing road bikes and components.

title: Orbea
description: Spanish cooperative from the Basque Country building road, gravel and mountain bikes.

title: Wilier
description: Italian brand dating to 1906, known for elegant, race-focused road bikes.
